privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: This Privacy Policy ("Policy") explains how BodyFlow (https://bodyflow.com.ua) collects, uses, and protects users’ personal data. By using the website and its features (calorie calculator, meal plan generator, personal account), you agree to the terms of this Policy.
privacy.s1_1_li1: Name and email address during registration.
privacy.s1_1_li2: Data entered into calculators (age, height, weight, activity level, nutrition goals, and related parameters).
privacy.s1_1_li3: Information stored in your personal account (calculations, meal plans, preferences).
privacy.s1_2_li1: IP address, device type, and browser type.
privacy.s1_2_li3: Visited pages and time spent on the website.
privacy.s2_1_li1: To ensure proper operation of the service.
privacy.s2_1_li2: To calculate calorie needs and generate personalized nutrition recommendations.
privacy.s2_1_li3: To store user data in personal accounts.
privacy.s2_1_li4: To analyze website usage and improve functionality.
privacy.s2_1_li5: To display advertisements through third-party services (including Google AdSense).
privacy.s3_1_text: BodyFlow uses cookies to ensure proper website functionality, analyze traffic, and display advertisements.
privacy.s3_2_text: We may use Google AdSense to display advertisements. Google and its partners may use cookies to show ads based on your previous visits to this and other websites.
privacy.s3_2_li1: Google uses advertising cookies to provide personalized ads.
privacy.s3_2_li2: Users may opt out of personalized advertising via Google Ads Settings (https://adssettings.google.com).
privacy.s3_2_li3: Other third-party vendors may also use cookies for advertising purposes.
privacy.s3_3_text: You can disable cookies in your browser settings; however, this may affect certain website features.
privacy.s4_1_text: We do not sell or share personal data with third parties except in the following cases:
privacy.s4_1_li1: Hosting providers and technical contractors supporting website functionality.
privacy.s5_1_text: We implement technical measures to protect personal data, including HTTPS encryption and restricted access to stored information.
privacy.s5_2_text: Data is retained for the duration of the user account or until deletion is requested.
privacy.s6_1_li1: Request access to your personal data.
privacy.s6_1_li2: Request correction or deletion of your data.
privacy.s7_text: BodyFlow provides nutritional calculations and recommendations for informational purposes only. The content does not constitute medical advice and should not replace professional consultation with a healthcare provider.
privacy.s8_text: We may update this Policy from time to time. Updates take effect upon publication on the website.
privacy.s9_text: If you have questions regarding personal data processing, please contact us:

meta.title: BMI Calculator Online – Body Mass Index and Healthy Weight
meta.description: Calculate your Body Mass Index (BMI) online. Find out whether your weight is within the normal range and get nutrition and calorie recommendations.

imt_page.intro_p1: Body Mass Index (BMI) is a simple and quick way to evaluate the relationship between weight and height and determine whether a person falls within a healthy range. With the online BMI calculator, you can get your result in seconds and gain a general understanding of your body weight status.
imt_page.intro_p2: Calculating BMI is the first step toward weight control, weight loss, or muscle gain. However, it is important to understand that BMI alone does not provide a complete picture of your health — it is only a starting point.

what.title: What Is Body Mass Index
what.p1: Body Mass Index is a numerical value calculated based on a person’s weight and height. It is widely used worldwide for the preliminary assessment of underweight, normal weight, or overweight status.
what.list_2: identify potential risks of excess weight
what.list_3: understand whether dietary adjustments are needed
what.note: BMI does not take body composition into account (body fat percentage, muscle mass, body type), so the result should be interpreted together with other health indicators.

formula.title: BMI Formula
formula.p1: Body Mass Index is calculated using the formula:
formula.p3: For example: if your weight is 70 kg and your height is 1.75 m: 70 / (1.75 × 1.75) = 22.9
formula.p4: The resulting value is compared with standard BMI ranges. This formula is used by most online BMI calculators.

table.title: BMI Classification Table
table.p1: According to WHO recommendations, BMI values are interpreted as follows:
table.note: These values are general guidelines and apply to most adults.

result.title: What Your Result Means
result.p1: If your BMI falls within the normal range, it means that your weight-to-height ratio is balanced.
result.p2: If your result is above or below the normal range, it may indicate the need to:
result.list_3: change your level of physical activity
result.note: However, BMI alone does not answer how many calories you need daily or how to properly structure your nutrition plan.

limits.title: Why BMI Alone Is Not Enough
limits.p1: Body Mass Index does not consider:
limits.note: For example, an athlete with high muscle mass may have a BMI above the normal range while having low body fat. That is why calculating daily calorie needs and macronutrient balance is essential for a more accurate assessment.

next.title: How to Move from BMI to a Real Nutrition Plan
next.p1: After determining your BMI, the next logical step is calculating your daily calorie needs.
next.p3: you can determine your individual calorie target and optimal balance of protein, fats, and carbohydrates.
next.p4: The BodyFlow service allows you to:
next.p6: define your goal (weight loss, maintenance, muscle gain)
next.p8: This way, you move from a simple BMI number to a structured and balanced nutrition plan.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.item_1_q: What is BMI in simple terms?
faq.item_1_a: It is an indicator that helps determine whether a person’s weight matches their height.
faq.item_2_a: BMI is an approximate indicator and does not account for body composition.
faq.item_3_a: For people with high muscle mass, BMI may not be fully accurate.
faq.item_4_a: For adults, a BMI between 18.5 and 24.9 is considered normal.
faq.item_5_q: Can you lose weight by focusing only on BMI?
faq.item_5_a: No. Effective weight control requires managing calorie intake and macronutrient balance.

meta.title: Calorie and Macro Calculator Online – Daily Intake Calculation
meta.description: Calorie and macro calculator online. Calculate your daily calorie needs, protein, fat and carb intake for weight loss, maintenance or muscle gain.

kbsu_page.intro_p1: The calorie and macro calculator helps you accurately estimate your daily calorie needs and optimal protein, fat and carbohydrate intake based on your goal. Whether you want to lose weight, maintain your current shape or gain muscle — proper calculation is the foundation of results.
kbsu_page.intro_p2: Online calorie calculation allows you to create a calorie deficit or surplus, control nutrition and build a balanced diet without extreme dieting.

what.title: What Are Calories and Macros
what.p1: Calories represent energy intake, while macros — protein, fat and carbohydrates — determine how your body uses that energy.
what.list_3: fat — hormone balance and vitamin absorption
what.note: The balance of calories and macros determines the effectiveness of weight loss, maintenance or muscle gain. To understand your starting point before calculating calories, it is recommended to determine your

formula.title: How Daily Calorie Needs Are Calculated
formula.p1: Daily calorie intake is calculated using the Mifflin–St Jeor formula, which considers weight, height, age and gender.
formula.p3: BMR is your basal metabolic rate, and TDEE is your total daily energy expenditure.
formula.p4: TDEE is used to determine whether you need a calorie deficit for weight loss or a surplus for muscle gain.

table.title: Macros for Different Goals
table.p1: Macro ratios vary depending on your goal:
table.list_1: Weight loss — 10–20% calorie deficit and higher protein intake
table.list_4: Body recomposition — controlled carbs and higher protein
table.note: Personalized calculations are always more accurate than generic recommendations.

result.title: What You Get After Calculation
result.p1: After calculation, you receive your daily calorie target and exact macro breakdown.
result.note: Without calculating calories, it is difficult to predict changes in body weight.

limits.title: Why a Calculator Alone Is Not Enough
limits.p1: A calorie calculator provides an estimate and does not account for:
limits.note: Therefore, it is important not only to know the numbers but also to apply them correctly in your diet. For a more accurate assessment of your body condition, it is recommended to additionally calculate your
limits.note_1: and consider it together with your daily calorie needs.

next.title: From Numbers to a Real Meal Plan
next.p1: After calculating your calorie needs, the next step is building a practical meal plan.
next.list_3: a balanced daily menu is created
next.p3: This makes it easier to reach your goal without restrictive dieting.
next.p6: adjust the diet to your goal
next.p8: This way you move from simple calorie numbers to a structured personal menu.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.item_1_q: How many calories do I need to lose weight?
faq.item_1_a: A calorie deficit of about 10–20% below your daily needs is typically recommended.
faq.item_2_a: Macros are calculated based on your weight, height, age, gender and activity level.
faq.item_3_q: Do I have to count calories?
faq.item_3_a: Calorie tracking significantly improves consistency and results.
faq.item_4_q: How much protein do I need daily?
faq.item_4_a: Most people benefit from 1.6–2.2 grams of protein per kilogram of body weight.

kbsu_page.cta: Calculate calories & Get Your Meal Plan

meta.title: Personalized Meal Plan Online with Calories and Macros
meta.description: Create a personalized meal plan online based on your calories, macronutrients and goal. Automatic 5-day meal plan without dieting or manual calculations.

menu_page.h1: Personalized Meal Plan Online Based on Calories and Goals
menu_page.intro_p1: A personalized meal plan online is an automatically generated nutrition plan that takes into account your daily calorie intake, macronutrient balance and chosen goal: weight loss, maintenance or muscle gain, calculated using the
menu_page.intro_p2: The BodyFlow system creates a ready-to-use 5-day meal plan based on your age, weight, height and activity level. You get a structured nutrition plan without manual calorie tracking.

what.title: What Is a Personalized Meal Plan
what.p1: A personalized meal plan is a diet created based on your individual calorie and macronutrient calculation.
what.note: Before creating a meal plan, it is recommended to determine your

formula.title: How the Automatic Meal Plan Is Generated
formula.p1: First, the system calculates your Basal Metabolic Rate (BMR) and Total Daily Energy Expenditure (TDEE).
formula.p2: TDEE adjusted to your goal = individual calorie target
formula.p3: Calories are then distributed between proteins, fats and carbohydrates.
formula.p4: Based on this data, foods are selected and a balanced meal plan is generated.

table.title: Meal Plans for Different Goals
table.p1: The nutrition plan adapts depending on your goal:
table.note: An individualized plan is more effective than generic diets.

result.title: What You Get
result.p1: After entering your data, you receive a ready-to-use 5-day meal plan.
result.note: The meal plan is built according to your personal calorie target.

limits.title: Why Auto-Generated Plans Are Better Than Generic Diets
limits.p1: Standard meal plans do not consider individual factors such as:
limits.note: For accurate results, it is important to first calculate your
limits.note_1: and use them to structure your nutrition.

next.title: How to Create Your Personalized Meal Plan
next.p1: To get your automatic meal plan, simply enter your personal data.
next.p3: You instantly receive a ready-made nutrition plan.
next.p8: This way you move from calculations to a practical, personalized nutrition plan.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.item_1_q: Does the meal plan work for different goals?
faq.item_1_a: Yes. The nutrition plan is generated for weight loss, maintenance or muscle gain.
faq.item_2_q: How many days does the plan include?
faq.item_2_a: The system generates a ready 5-day meal plan.
faq.item_3_a: Yes, calorie calculations are based on your physical activity level.
faq.item_4_q: Do I need to track calories manually?
faq.item_4_a: No. The system automatically calculates calories and macronutrients.
